bug.summary: "kfctl apply k8s" fails to deploy scheduledworkflows on mac
bug.description:
Hi, I'm trying to install Kubeflow on "Docker for mac with K8s" with these instructions from the <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/getting-started-k8s/>documentation</denchmark-link> . <denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>kubectl version Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"10", GitVersion:"v1.10.11", GitCommit:"637c7e288581ee40ab4ca210618a89a555b6e7e9", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2018-11-26T14:38:32Z", GoVersion:"go1.9.3", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"darwin/amd64"} Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"10", GitVersion:"v1.10.11", GitCommit:"637c7e288581ee40ab4ca210618a89a555b6e7e9", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2018-11-26T14:25:46Z", GoVersion:"go1.9.3", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"} </denchmark-code>
Kubeflow has been downloaded from <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/releases/tag/v0.5.0>https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/releases/tag/v0.5.0</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-code>kfctl version v20181207-4e7f4ed-198-gaeea303e-dirty-03e65e </denchmark-code>
The version number is confusing for a release. <denchmark-h:h3>Issue</denchmark-h>
To install Kubeflow I used the following commands: <denchmark-code>export KFAPP=kubeflow kfctl init ${KFAPP} cd ${KFAPP} kfctl generate k8s kfctl apply k8s </denchmark-code>
kfctl returned the following error message: <denchmark-code>ERRO[0061] (Will retry) Component pipeline apply failed; Error: handle object: creating object: creating object: CustomResourceDefinition.apiextensions.k8s.io "scheduledworkflows.kubeflow.org" is invalid: spec.version: Required value filename="ksonnet/ksonnet.go:174" </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h3>Workaround</denchmark-h>
Edit the files ks_app/vendor/kubeflow/pipeline/pipeline-scheduledworkflow.libsonnet and ks_app/vendor/kubeflow/pipeline/pipeline-viewercrd.libsonnet from the generated folder and add the line version: "v1beta1", to crd.spec. <denchmark-code>... crd: { apiVersion: "apiextensions.k8s.io/v1beta1", kind: "CustomResourceDefinition", metadata: { name: "scheduledworkflows.kubeflow.org", }, spec: { version: "v1beta1", ... </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h3>Expected behaviour</denchmark-h>
`kfctl generate k8s¬¥ creates a valid configuration

Could you submit a fix and cherry pick to the v0.5-branch? I wonder why this doesn't seem to affect everyone? <denchmark-link:https://github.com/0xE282B0>@0xE282B0</denchmark-link> What version of K8s are you using?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jlewi>@jlewi</denchmark-link> I'm using docker desktop for mac and it comes with a K8s v1.10.11 <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4034494/57938054-93806100-78c7-11e9-898a-23e32855b865.png></denchmark-link>

The CRD API is using new K8s CRD multi-version API which is supported in v1.11 and after. Here is more context <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/design-proposals/api-machinery/customresources-versioning.md>https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/design-proposals/api-machinery/customresources-versioning.md</denchmark-link>
The workaround looks good for earlier version.
